item.title: Sign obstructing footway, 28th October
item.description:
North side of Tatchley Lane/Prestbury Road junction, Prestbury. The sign is partially obstructing the footway and does not allow the DoT requirement for 1 metre minimum footway width. As there is no footway on the South side, pedestrians may be forced to move into the road where it is especially narrow,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tatchley Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 28th October
item.description:
Customer reports a pothole approximately 1 metre long by around 12"" wide and deeper than a tennis ball at the location; they describe it as an 'abrupt' drop when driving into the hole.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary Crossing In Possibly Dangerous State, 28th October
item.description:
Could you attend to the pedestrian crossing on Grovefield Way near the junction with North Road West as soon as possible please. The crossing has failed and been replaced with a temporary crossing. For some reason the temporary crossing lights facing into traffic have been withdrawn from the road and pointed outwards but yet the unit remains switched on. This means you can press the crossing button but the traffic will never be stopped. It might be possible for the green man to appear without indicating to the traffic that it should stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grovefield Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction
